ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Re: Copy solution object in Matlab

The main problem is that the *.cti file of the solution object is not 
known at priori and it can not be obtained by any methods of the 
Solution class.

Thank you for your attention

Michele

andrew.mackrory ha scritto:
> This is what I would do:
> Define a new solution object, then set its properties using the 
> properties of the existing solution, like this example for 
> temperature, pressure, and composition:
> 
> gas 1 already exists...
> 
> gas2 = GRI30;
> set(gas2,'T',temperature(gas1),'P',pressure(gas1),'X',moleFractions
> (gas1));
> 
> I am not an expert programmer, so there may be a slicker way to do it.
> 
> Andrew
> 
> --- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, Michele Vascellari <vascellari@...> 
> wrote:
>> Dear all,
>> I have the following trouble using the Cantera toolbox for Matlab.
>> I need to create a new solution object starting from an existing 
> one.
>> I've tried to copy the first object using the equal operator (=), 
> but in 
>> this way the two objects have the same handles. In fact changing 
>> something in one object, I change also the other one.
>> Is there some way to create a new solution object starting from a 
>> previous one with a different handles?
>>
>> Thank you for your attention,
>>
>> Michele
>>
